Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Storage and access structures, database models and languages, database design, techniques for parallel database systems, emerging data management technology.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Mandatory meeting with students and their faculty advisor for career/academic advising.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (CNT 3004 and COP 3330) or (COP 3503C and Computer Science major) each with grades of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Digital libraries. Media formats. Compression. Streaming Media. Mobile internet and WML. Emerging technologies. Capacity planning for web services.

College.title: College
College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: An overview of the IT field, job opportunities and careers in information technology, detailed information about some jobs as well as a broad survey.

College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (COP 4600 or CGS 3763) and (CIS 3360 or CIS 3362) or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Operating system forensics, digital media forensics, networking forensics, various digital devices forensics. User activity profiling and digital storage recovery.

CIS4361 - Secure Operating Systems and A.name: CIS4361 - Secure Operating Systems and Administration

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CIS 3360 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better;

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Understanding of secure operating systems requirements, design principles and theories, protection methods, access control, authentication, vulnerability, analysis and case studies.

College.text: College of Engineering and Computer Science

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A directed and supervised investigation of selected problems, issues, and trends in cybersecurity, with emphasis on laboratory simulations of system penetration methods and network defense strategies.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: (COP 4600 or CGS 3763) and (CIS 3360 or CIS 3362) or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Threat modeling and risk analysis, development of secure software, software assurance techniques, analyzing and auditing software.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: CIS 3003 or COP 3503C and Computer Science major, with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Requirements, acquisition and sourcing. Integration. Project management. Testing and QA. Organizational context. Architecture.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: COP 3223C or EGN 3211, and MAC 1114C each with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Encryption algorithms and ciphers. Public and private keys. Key infrastructures. Authentication, confidentiality, integrity, and nonrepudiation. Digital signatures and certificates. Hash and digest algorithms. Standards.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Pervasive themes in IT. Organizational issues. History of IT. IT and its related and informing disciplines. Application domains. Applications of math and statistics to IT.

Prerequisites.text: COP 3223C or EGN 3211 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Security theory. Legal and human factors, Malware, Intrusion patterns and tools, Windows, Unix, TCP/IP, and applications vulnerabilities. Detection. Policies and enforcement. Protection and assurance.
